title: Jaguars' Little nails would-be-record 70-yard FG

title: Moore, out all of '24, hurt on first play for Vikings

content: Victory is in the mind, Army chief General Upendra Dwivedi underlined, while explaining Pakistan's narrative management system during Operation Sindoor, which managed to convince its citizens that they had won in the recent conflict.

title: IndiGo Fined Rs 1.5 Lakh For Providing "Unhygienic, Dirty" Seat To Passenger
content: A Delhi consumer forum has held Indigo Airlines guilty of deficiency of service for providing an unhygienic and stained seat to a woman and directed it to pay a compensation of Rs 1.5 lakh for the discomfort, pain, and mental agony she suffered.

title: BJP Expels Rajasthan Spokesperson For Criticising Party's 'Treatment' Of Jagdeep Dhankhar
content: The Rajasthan unit of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) expelled state spokesperson Krishna Kumar Janu for six years, citing his public criticism of the party's "treatment" of former governor Satya Pal Malik and ex-vice president Jagdeep Dhankhar.

title: "Clear Political Will, No Restrictions": Air Force Chief On Op Sindoor Success
content: India launched Operation Sindoor on May 7 as a decisive military response to the deadly April 22 Pahalgam terror attack.

title: "India Won't Yield To Threats, US Not Able To Digest Our Growth": Venkaiah Naidu
content: India will not compromise on its strategic and national interests and will continue to safeguard its energy security despite external pressure, former Vice-President M Venkaiah Naidu said on Saturday amid escalating US trade tensions.

title: Trump Considering Inviting Zelensky To Alaska Amid Putin's Visit: Report
content: The White House is considering inviting Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to Alaska, where President Donald Trump is scheduled to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin on August 15, NBC News reported on Saturday.

title: "1962 War Failure Of China Policy, Not Non-Alignment:" Ex-Diplomat Shivshankar Menon
content: The 1962 war with China was not a failure of non-alignment policy but that of China policy and this can be gauged by the amount of support India received from across world, irrespective of ideologies, according to former diplomat Shivshankar Menon

title: US Senator Urges India To Use Its 'Influence' To Help Trump End Ukraine War
content: US Senator Lindsey Graham has urged India to use its "influence" to help President Donald Trump end the Ukraine war, hours after Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: Muslim Countries Must Unite: Turkey Slams Israel's Gaza Move
content: Muslim nations must act in unison and rally international opposition against Israel's plan to take control of Gaza City, Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan said on Saturday after talks in Egypt.

title: Woman's Head, Chopped Up Body Found In Plastic Bags In Karnataka
content: The severed head and dismembered body of a woman were found stuffed in multiple plastic bags along the road at Kolala village in Koratagere.

title: Maharashtra Government To Probe 26 Lakh 'Suspect' Beneficiaries Of Ladki Bahin Yojana
content: The Maharashtra government has ordered a large-scale verification drive targeting over 26 lakh beneficiaries of the Mukhyamantri Ladki Bahin Yojana amid suspicions of widespread ineligibility and misuse

title: Maharashtra Man Murders Mother Over Farmland Dispute, Then Kills Self
content: A 45-year-old man allegedly murdered his 70-year-old mother over a dispute concerning agricultural land and later took his own life in Maharashtra's Latur district.

title: Delhi Metro Sets New Ridership Record At Over 81-Lakh On Rakhi Eve
content: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) on Saturday announced that it had achieved its highest-ever single-day ridership on August 8, 2025, with 81,87,674 passenger journeys recorded across all operational corridors.

title: Sold For Marriage Twice, Missing Bengal Girl Rescued From Rajasthan

content: US warfare expert John Spencer said many surprises marked Operation Sindoor, ones which are not expected in the clash of two advanced militaries.

title: UP Auto Driver Strangles Woman To Death For Not Wanting To Marry Him
content: An auto driver and his associate were arrested Saturday in connection with the strangling of a woman, whose body was found near the Mant Branch Gang Canal in Raya area, police said.

title: Millennials, Gen Z Account For Two-Thirds Of Blue-Collar Job Applicants: Report
content: In the blue collar category, Millennials and Gen Z continued to remain among the country's highest job-seeking population, accounting for 65 per cent of all job applications in 2024 as well as 2025, a report said on Saturday.

title: Bailey bridge construction nears completion to restore connectivity in flood-hit Uttarkashi: Officials
content: The search for the missing in the flood-ravaged Dharali also continued, with the help of SDRF sniffer dogs and equipment such as victim locating and thermal imaging cameras.

content: Traffic is likely to be affected due to the PM‚Äôs visit; Bengaluru Police have imposed traffic restrictions on a few major roads today between 8.30 a.m. and 2.30 p.m.

content: Online applications can be submitted from August 12 to 20, while verification of eligibility will be done on August 21; Lottery results will be declared on August 25

M. Soundariya Preetha dives deep to find out more

content: State Education Policy (SEP) Commission chairman Sukhadeo Thorat told The Hindu that the commission in its report submitted to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Friday, had opposed allowing foreign universities directly setting up their campuses in Karnataka.¬†

content: The project was initially scheduled for completion by December 2021 but was plagued by a series of setbacks, including delays in land acquisition, the COVID-19 pandemic, and hold-ups in rolling stock supply from the Chinese manufacturer CRRC Nanjing

title: SEP recommends reservation in admissions for SC/STs, OBC students in private colleges and universities

title: Systematic pattern of mischief in maintaining electoral rolls: Kamal Nath
content: The Congress leader underlined the demand for machine-readable electoral rolls to be given to parties by citing how he had raised issues regarding voter lists in Madhya Pradesh back in 2018

content: Minister Narayana announced that 11 government high schools in Nellore will be renovated by next academic year

content: Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy on Saturday hit out at BJP leaders, including State president B.Y. Vijayendra and MP for Bengaluru South Tejasvi Surya, for claiming that the Yellow Line ‚Äî set to be inaugurated on August 10¬†‚Äî¬†was solely a Central government initiative.

content: The recent chastisement raises two questions, whether the top court can act as an ‚Äòelder brother‚Äô to High Courts and if ‚Äòinstitutional concerns affecting rule of law‚Äô would give the top court authority to intervene in the exclusive ‚Äòmaster of roster‚Äô powers of the Chief Justice of a State High Court

title: Damaged road makes daily commute tortuous in Vellaikoil
content: Residents have sought a separate ration shop for Vellakoil, pointing out that they had to travel nearly 2 km to Perumal Pettai to collect their rations

content: Delegates from South Korea based global peace organisation Heavenly Culture, World Peace, Restoration of Light (HWPL)¬†visited Mahatma Gandhi Rural Development and Panchayat Raj University in Gadag on Saturday and had a dialogue with Minister for Law, Justice, Human Rights, Parliamentary Affairs, Legislative Affairs and Tourism H. K. Patil.

title: Chhattisgarh government to launch Gaudham Yojana for stray cattle protection
content: Scheme to focus on curbing illegal trafficking; will effectively replace the Baghel government‚Äôs Gauthan Yojana

title: Decision on revival of G.O. 3 soon, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: As per the G.O., which was quashed by the Apex court, only local tribal people are eligible for government jobs in the Scheduled Areas; NDA Government striving to improve infrastructure, raise living standards, and boost the incomes of the tribal communities, he says

title: Overall development of tribal people important for A.P.‚Äôs growth: NTR Collector
content: Focus is on development of infrastructure in tribal areas, and ashram schools are being set up to provide quality education to tribal students, says G. Lakshmish

title: DCC president, LDF candidate allege large-scale voters‚Äô list manipulation in Thrissur LS poll
content: Joseph Tajet accuses BJP‚Äôs Suresh Gopi of orchestrating fraudulent entries; Sunilkumar questions returning officer‚Äôs role and claims deliberate misinformation

title: India welcomes Donald Trump-Vladimir Putin summit in Alaska
content: The meeting holds the promise of bringing to an end the ongoing conflict in Ukraine and opening up the prospects for peace, says Ministry of External Affairs

title: Government has disbursed ‚Çπ1,000 crore to families displaced by Polavaram project: MLA
content: CC roads, drainages and other works worth ‚Çπ85 crore have been taken up in the tribal villages in Eluru district, says Chirri Balaraju

title: 28 out of 33 districts in Telangana have higher concentration of fluoride in groundwater: Report
content: Higher concentration of fluoride in drinking water is linked to a host of debilitating diseases like waterborne fluorosis, dental and skeletal fluorosis

title: 705 deaths in 10 yrs: Flash floods a major killer in U'khand; climate change reshaping Himalayas
content: Uttarakhand faces a deadly pattern of natural disasters. Flash floods and landslides killed hundreds in the last decade. Data shows nearly 3,500 people died in natural disasters. Studies flag Uttarakhand as a hotspot for extreme weather events. Experts call for urgent action. This includes climate-resilient infrastructure and early warning systems. Unchecked development in hazard-prone zones must stop.

title: 'If you ask a Pakistani ...': Army chief mocks Pak victory claim
content: Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi criticized Pakistan's claims of victory in the May clashes following Operation Sindoor, highlighting the importance of narrative management in war. He emphasized that the Centre granted the armed forces a "free hand" to execute Operation Sindoor after the Pahalgam attack.

title: Wobble Trouble! The mystery ball behind Siraj‚Äôs success against England
content: Mohammed Siraj's mastery of the wobble seam ball proved pivotal in India's recent Test series against England, where he emerged as the leading wicket-taker with 23 wickets. This unpredictable delivery, which moves both ways off the pitch, kept batters guessing. Siraj, along with Akash Deep and Prasidh Krishna, effectively utilised it.

title: Army troops launch anti-terror operation in Kishtwar; gunfire exchanged
content: In the Kishtwar region of Jammu and Kashmir, a gunfight erupted between security forces and terrorists on Sunday. Indian Army troops, acting on intelligence, made contact with the terrorists in the Dul area early on August 10. An exchange of gunfire ensued, and the operation is currently ongoing as security forces work to neutralize the threat.

title: Pakistan lost Rs 127cr in 2 months after closing airspace for India, says report
content: Pakistan Airports Authority faced a revenue loss of approximately Rs 123 crore after closing its airspace to Indian-registered aircraft between April 24 and June 30, according to Dawn. This action, following India's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, impacted numerous Indian flights daily. A similar closure in 2019 had previously cost Pakistan an estimated Rs 228 crore.

title: Mark Zuckerberg hired people at $100 mn-plus pay packages: Skills that land job at Meta; Degree in‚Ä¶
content: Meta's CEO Mark Zuckerberg is aggressively pursuing top AI talent for a new superintelligence lab, targeting researchers from elite universities and leading companies like OpenAI and Google DeepMind. Zuckerberg personally oversees recruitment, offering lucrative packages to secure promising individuals.

title: Cops on lookout for fake doctor who ran clinic for 10yrs; gave patients steroid shots
content: Following an anonymous tip, Bengaluru police are searching for Munendrachari K, who allegedly operated a fraudulent medical clinic in Doddakannahalli for a decade. Posing as a family physician, he prescribed allopathic medicines and steroid injections, despite claiming to be an Ayurvedic doctor. Investigations revealed a fake registration certificate, leading to the clinic's closure and a police complaint.

title: Leopard mauls 3-year-old to death in Nashik, sister ties rakhi before cremation
content: A tragic incident occurred near Nashik. Ayush Bhagat, a three-year-old boy, was killed in a leopard attack. The incident took place near his home. Family members and villagers searched for him after he went missing. Forest personnel used thermal drone cameras in the search. Ayush's body was found in a sugarcane field with severe injuries.

title: Trump confronts Intel CEO: 3 big security questions asked; says resignation is inevitable
content: Donald Trump called for Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan's immediate resignation due to concerns over his investments in Chinese firms with ties to the People's Liberation Army. Senator Tom Cotton raised critical questions about potential conflicts of interest, especially given Intel's national security responsibilities and CHIPS Act subsidies. Tan defended his leadership, dismissing the criticism as misinformation.

title: ‚Çπ5.41 lakh! Shubman Gill's signed jersey fetches massive sum in auction; Pant's cap goes for over a lakh
content: Shubman Gill's signed India Test jersey from Lord's fetched ‚Çπ5.41 lakh at auction, topping Red For Ruth charity sales. The auction included memorabilia from Indian and English players. Jasprit Bumrah and Ravindra Jadeja's jerseys secured ‚Çπ4.94 lakh each, while Rishabh Pant's cap reached ‚Çπ1.76 lakh. Joe Root's cap was popular at ‚Çπ3.52 lakh.

title: IndiGo fined Rs 1.5L over dirty seats, passenger's mental agony
content: IndiGo Airlines has been held liable by the District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission in New Delhi for providing unhygienic and stained seats on a flight from Baku to Delhi. The commission found this to be a deficiency in service, violating consumer expectations. Consequently, the airline has been directed to pay a compensation of Rs 1.

title: Evolution of Prasidh Krishna: Impressed at The Oval, but real test awaits at home
content: Prasidh Krishna's impressive eight-wicket haul at The Oval marked a potential turning point in his career, showcasing his adaptability and mental fortitude. Despite initial struggles with his length in the series, he adjusted his approach to secure a crucial win for India.

title: Nvidia CEO checks salaries of company's 42,000 employees; says: It's a strategy that‚Ä¶
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang personally reviews the compensation of all 42,000 employees monthly, utilizing machine learning to optimize the process. He dismisses rumors of secret stock options, emphasizing generous compensation for all workers. Huang believes in prioritizing employee well-being, which he feels drives overall success. This strategy has significantly benefited Nvidia's leadership, creating billionaires within his management team.

title: Delhi triple murder: Man who killed wife, 2 daughters arrested
content: In a shocking incident in Delhi's Karawal Nagar, Pradeep Kumar allegedly strangled his wife, Jayashree, and their two young daughters following a dispute. Police arrested Kumar, suspecting a possible suicide attempt due to cuts on his hand. Financial struggles stemming from gambling debts and his father's death reportedly fueled domestic tension.

title: PM Modi to inaugurate Namma Metro Yellow Line ‚Äî Here's what you should know
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate Namma Metro's Yellow Line on Sunday, with regular operations commencing Monday at 5 am. He will travel from Ragigudda to Infosys Foundation-Konappana Agrahara station, accompanied by dignitaries. Several train services will be short-terminated or delayed due to the PM's visit to KSR Bengaluru railway station for the Vande Bharat Express inauguration.

title: Tyreek Hill, ex Keeta Vaccaro rush baby Capri to ER; now recovering
content: Tyreek Hill's eight-month-old daughter, Capri, was rushed to the emergency room after developing alarming symptoms, causing significant concern for her mother, Keeta Vaccaro. Doctors swiftly stabilized Capri, and her condition improved by sunrise. Despite ongoing family turmoil, the outpouring of support from fans highlights the shared relief and gratitude for Capri's recovery.

title: McDavid and Lauren Kyle steal the show at Draisaitl‚Äôs fairytale wedding
content: Connor McDavid and Lauren Kyle captivated fans with their charm and elegance at a Provence wedding, overshadowing rumors of another NHL star's nuptials. Lauren's Instagram posts offered a genuine glimpse into the dreamy festivities, showcasing understated style and heartfelt moments. Fans celebrated the couple's natural chemistry and the weekend's blend of style, love, and authentic connection.

title: Evander Kane celebrates Leon Draisaitl and Celeste Desjardins‚Äô wedding in style
content: Evander Kane, former Oilers forward, attended Leon Draisaitl and Celeste Desjardins' wedding in France, sharing photos on Instagram with a heartfelt message. Accompanied by fianc√©e Mara Teigen, Kane joined other NHL stars like Connor Brown and Ryan Nugent-Hopkins at the lavish event. Lauren Kyle, Connor McDavid's wife, was a bridesmaid.

title: 'I think its just for ... ' - Ex-England skipper makes bold claim on Pant's batting; David Warner mimics batter
content: David Warner and Alastair Cook playfully analysed Rishabh Pant's audacious shot-making during a recent chat after a The Hundred match. Warner even imitated Pant's signature move, highlighting the Indian batter's influence. Pant's aggressive approach and innovative strokes have captivated audiences and seemingly inspired players like Harry Brook, showcasing the impact of his unique flair on the game.

title: Rohit Sharma on the big screen! Movie theatre erupts in celebration for India's ODI captain - Watch!
content: Rohit Sharma, the former Test captain, recently appeared in a fan tribute video for actor Mahesh Babu's 50th birthday, creating a buzz on social media. The video, celebrating both icons, featured Sharma lifting the 2024 T20 World Cup trophy. Fans cheered and captured the moment, highlighting the crossover of cricket and cinema.

title: Seven superclouds: Giant gas neighbours of our solar system discovered
content: Astronomers have identified seven massive superclouds of gas near our solar system, reshaping our understanding of interstellar space. These structures, thousands of light-years across, are potential star birthplaces, possibly formed from the Milky Way's spiral arms. The discovery, enabled by advanced mapping, reveals a galactic framework influencing star formation and galactic evolution, opening new avenues for astronomical research.

title: Selena Gomez on Swift amid reported split with Blake Lively
content: Amidst personal changes, Taylor Swift's friendship with Blake Lively reportedly ended due to legal issues involving Justin Baldoni. Selena Gomez discussed her long-standing bond with Swift, revealing their shared history of dating Jonas Brothers. Swift and Kelce are expected at Gomez's wedding. Swift has been seen reconnecting with Gomez, while distancing herself from Lively and Ryan Reynolds.

title: Haunted by 'ghosts of Balakot', IAF chief comes armed with proof - see news pics
content: In retaliation to the Pahalgam killings, the Indian Air Force (IAF) released compelling evidence of Operation Sindoor, showcasing precision airstrikes deep inside Pakistan. IAF chief Amar Preet Singh presented visual proof of the destruction of key military and terror infrastructure, including the Nur Khan Airbase, JeM headquarters in Bahawalpur, and LeT headquarters in Muridke.

title: 'It‚Äôs embedded in mind': Karthik reveals why 'keepers read wrist spin better
content: Dinesh Karthik shared insights on playing wrist spinners like Rashid Khan, emphasising wicketkeepers' advantage due to familiarity and lower body strength. He noted their proficiency in sweep shots and ability to pick cues effectively. Karthik highlighted Sanju Samson as the only wicketkeeper-batter among top performers against Rashid Khan, adding that flat-batted slog sweeps are crucial for negating spin.

title: IPL | ‚ÄòHow did it feel getting smashed by a 14-year-old?‚Äô ‚Äì R Ashwin shares
content: R Ashwin lauded Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old batting sensation, sharing an anecdote from an IPL match where Suryavanshi impressed with his composure and shot selection against Ashwin's bowling. Ashwin recounted Jos Buttler and Jofra Archer's amazement at Suryavanshi's talent. Sanju Samson also praised the young player's consistent hitting and quality strokes during the IPL season.

title: 'Ukrainians will not give their land': Zelenskyy vows to block 'second partition attempt'
content: Volodymyr Zelenskyy accused Vladimir Putin of attempting to legitimize the occupation of Ukrainian territories under the guise of peace negotiations. Zelenskyy criticized the planned Trump-Putin summit in Alaska, asserting that decisions made without Ukraine's involvement are detrimental to peace. Meanwhile, drone strikes in Kherson and Zaporizhzhia resulted in casualties, while Russia claimed to have intercepted numerous Ukrainian drones.

title: Can earlobe crease predict heart attack, diabetes and stroke risk: Myths vs facts
content: Frank's Sign, a diagonal earlobe crease, has sparked debate regarding its link to cardiovascular issues. Studies suggest a modest association with coronary artery disease and stroke, but aging and other factors complicate the connection. Experts emphasize that it's not a definitive diagnostic tool, advising focus on established risk factors like blood pressure and family history.

title: Judicial irony: Justice Pardiwala faces heat for harsh HC judge order; past anti-quota row recalled
content: Justice J B Pardiwala, now in the Supreme Court, faced controversy for his remarks as a Gujarat HC judge. In 2015, his anti-reservation comments in a sedition case led to a removal motion, prompting him to expunge the remarks. Recently, his criticism of an Allahabad HC judge was also retracted after intervention, highlighting the complexities of judicial pronouncements.

title: NFL fans roast Allen over awkward Steinfeld comment ‚Äî internet reacts
content: Josh Allen and Hailee Steinfeld tied the knot in a lavish California ceremony, as revealed on HBO's Hard Knocks. Fans playfully reacted to Allen's marital bliss online. The couple is now streamlining their real estate, with Allen listing his bachelor pad for $8.5 million, focusing on their future together as Allen aims for a Super Bowl victory.

title: 'You can also do that': Samson reveals Sachin's knock that inspired his dream
content: Sanju Samson revealed that Sachin Tendulkar's 'Desert Storm' innings in Sharjah ignited his dream of playing for India. Witnessing Tendulkar's powerful batting inspired young Samson to believe in his own potential. Later, S. Sreesanth's support led to a crucial opportunity with Rajasthan Royals, where Rahul Dravid's influence further shaped his early career.

title: S-400 was a game-changer in Indo-Pak face-off: IAF
content: Air Chief Marshal A P Singh revealed that during Operation Sindoor, India achieved its largest surface-to-air kill by downing a Pakistani aircraft at 300km, crediting the S-400 system. The IAF also confirmed five kills of Pakistani fighters through electronic means. India targeted Pakistani airbases and infrastructure, including hangars and radar sites, causing significant damage and operational disruptions.

title: IPL: Ex-India batter picks ideal Dhoni replacement at CSK ‚Äî and explains why
content: Former India cricketer Kris Srikkanth has ignited IPL discussions by suggesting Rajasthan Royals skipper Sanju Samson as a potential successor to MS Dhoni in Chennai Super Kings, highlighting Samson's popularity in Tamil Nadu. While acknowledging Ruturaj Gaikwad as a captaincy option, Srikkanth emphasised Samson's skills and brand value for CSK.

title: Retired IG's daughter gets UP cop sacked by dad reinstated
content: In a remarkable legal battle, a lawyer daughter, Anura Singh, successfully fought against her own father, a former Inspector General of Police (IGP), to reinstate a wrongly terminated police head constable. The constable, Tofeek Ahmad, had been accused of molestation and dismissed after a departmental inquiry led by the IGP.

title: J&K: 2 soldiers killed as 9-day Kashmir gunfight grinds on
content: In a fierce gunfight in Kulgam, South Kashmir, Lance Naik Pritpal Singh and Sepoy Harminder Singh of the Sikh Light Infantry, attached to 19 Rashtriya Rifles, were killed during Operation Akhal. The counterterrorism operation, ongoing for nine days, targets Pakistan-trained terrorists in the Akhal Khulsan forest.

title: Defence production has soared to an all-time high of 1.5L cr, says Rajnath Singh
content: India's defence production has reached a record high of over Rs 1.5 lakh crore in FY 2024-25, marking an 18% increase from the previous year and a 90% surge since 2019-20. Defence exports have also risen to Rs 23,622 crore.

title: Festival discount: Railways to start round trip offer
content: To ease Diwali-Chhath rush, Indian Railways introduces a pilot 'round trip package' offering a 20% discount on base fares, excluding 'flexi fare' trains like Rajdhani and Vande Bharat. Booking starts August 14 for travel between October 13-26, with return journeys bookable for November 17-December 1.

title: Prepare for SIR of electoral rolls: Assam CEO to district officials
content: Assam is gearing up for a special intensive revision of electoral rolls, directed by the CEO ahead of the Election Commission's schedule. This preparation includes ensuring all election officials are in place and identifying additional booth-level officers. The Chief Minister emphasizes the need to cleanse voter lists, referencing concerns about alleged illegal entries, particularly in border areas.

title: Kapil Sibal: Where is Dhankhar, should we file habeas corpus?
content: Kapil Sibal, former minister, has raised concerns about the sudden disappearance of ex-Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar from public view since his resignation. Sibal expressed that he has been unable to reach Dhankhar and questioned whether a habeas corpus petition should be filed. He also urged the government to disclose Dhankhar's whereabouts and well-being.

title: Taylor Swift chaos: Disguised entrance to Travis Kelce‚Äôs game resurfaces, fans can‚Äôt keep calm
content: An old video of Taylor Swift walking into a Kansas City Chiefs game in September 2023 without security has resurfaced, shocking fans. Disguised in a mask and cap, she walked with Travis Kelce and friends, seizing a rare chance to experience normalcy.

title: Quit if you don't trust EC: BJP to Sonia, Rahul
content: BJP intensified its demand for Rahul Gandhi to substantiate his vote fraud allegations, highlighting his failure to accept the Election Commission's challenge to provide an affidavit. The party suggested Gandhi should resign from Lok Sabha if he lacks confidence in the EC.

title: Air India raises retirement age of pilots from 58 to 65
content: Air India has increased the retirement age for pilots from 58 to 65 years, aligning it with the previous Vistara pilots' retirement age following the merger last November. The retirement age for other employees has also been raised from 58 to 60.

title: ICICI Bank hikes min balance for savings a/cs from Rs 10k to Rs 50k
content: ICICI Bank has significantly increased the minimum balance requirement for new savings accounts opened after August 1st, raising it to Rs 50,000 for urban locations. This decision, a five-fold increase, contrasts with the trend of public sector banks waiving such requirements. The move has drawn criticism, with some bankers suggesting it aims to filter out low-value customers.

title: SC sets up panel led by ex-HC judge for Banke Bihari temple
content: The Supreme Court has established an 11-member interim high-powered committee, led by Justice Ashok Kumar, to oversee the Banke Bihari temple's operations and plan its holistic development. The court permitted the Uttar Pradesh government to acquire land for a corridor similar to the Kashi Vishwanath Temple.

title: Kiren Rijiju: New tax bill has essence of original bill
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju addressed concerns regarding the new Income Tax Bill, 2025, assuring that it integrates all amendments proposed by the select committee and accepted by the government. Rijiju emphasized that social media apprehensions are unfounded, as the bill reflects six months of diligent work and incorporates suggested changes, maintaining the original bill's essence.
